name: Rui Fish
description: Popular freshwater fish, perfect for curry
nutritionalInfo: High in protein, omega-3 fatty acids, and vitamin D. Low in mercury content.
cookingTips: Best prepared as curry, fried, or steamed. Marinate with turmeric and salt for 30 minutes before cooking.
storageInfo: Store in refrigerator at 0-4°C. Best consumed within 24 hours of purchase.

name: Hilsa
description: National fish of Bangladesh, rich in omega-3
nutritionalInfo: Extremely rich in omega-3 fatty acids, protein, and essential minerals. Contains vitamin B12 and selenium.
cookingTips: Steam with mustard paste, fry with minimal spices, or prepare traditional Bengali curry. Remove bones carefully.
storageInfo: Keep refrigerated. Can be frozen for up to 3 months. Thaw naturally before cooking.

name: Katla Fish
description: Large carp fish, great for special occasions
nutritionalInfo: Good source of protein and omega-3. Contains calcium, phosphorus, and vitamin A.
cookingTips: Excellent for curry, kalia, or jhol preparations. The head portion is considered a delicacy.
storageInfo: Refrigerate immediately. Best consumed fresh within 24 hours.

name: Prawns
nutritionalInfo: Low in calories, high in protein. Rich in selenium, vitamin B12, and phosphorus.
cookingTips: Devein before cooking. Perfect for grilling, curry, or stir-fry. Cook until pink and opaque.
storageInfo: Keep on ice or refrigerate. Can be frozen for up to 6 months.

name: Pangas Fish
nutritionalInfo: Lean protein source with low fat content. Contains essential amino acids.
cookingTips: Boneless and easy to cook. Great for frying, grilling, or light curry preparations.
storageInfo: Refrigerate at 0-4°C. Use within 48 hours for best quality.

name: Tilapia
nutritionalInfo: Good source of protein, niacin, vitamin B12, phosphorus, selenium and potassium.
cookingTips: Versatile fish suitable for all cooking methods. Absorbs flavors well.
storageInfo: Store in coldest part of refrigerator. Best used within 2 days.

name: Pomfret
nutritionalInfo: Rich in omega-3, protein, and vitamin D. Low in saturated fat.
cookingTips: Best when fried whole or steamed. Minimal spices recommended to preserve delicate flavor.
storageInfo: Keep refrigerated. Consume within 24 hours for optimal freshness.

name: Crab
nutritionalInfo: Excellent source of protein, omega-3, vitamin B12, and zinc. Low in calories.
cookingTips: Steam or boil with spices. Crack shells to extract meat. Perfect for curry or grilled preparations.
storageInfo: Keep alive until cooking or refrigerate immediately. Use within 12 hours.

name: Magur Fish
nutritionalInfo: High in protein and iron. Known for healing properties in traditional medicine.
cookingTips: Clean thoroughly. Best prepared as curry or soup. Excellent for recovery meals.
storageInfo: Keep alive in water or refrigerate immediately. Use within 24 hours.

name: Coral Fish
nutritionalInfo: Rich in omega-3 and minerals. Good source of lean protein.
cookingTips: Suitable for frying or light curry. Maintains firm texture when cooked.
storageInfo: Refrigerate immediately. Best consumed within 24 hours.

name: Shrimp
nutritionalInfo: Low in fat, high in protein. Contains iodine, zinc, and vitamin B12.
cookingTips: Quick cooking required. Perfect for stir-fry, grilling, or curry. Don't overcook.
storageInfo: Keep chilled. Can be frozen for up to 4 months.

name: Boal Fish
nutritionalInfo: High protein content with firm, meaty texture. Good source of minerals.
cookingTips: Excellent for grilling or tandoor. Can be prepared as steaks or curry.
storageInfo: Refrigerate at 0-4°C. Use within 36 hours.

name: Rupchanda
nutritionalInfo: Rich in omega-3, protein, and essential vitamins. Low cholesterol.
cookingTips: Best when fried or steamed whole. Minimal seasoning recommended.
storageInfo: Keep refrigerated. Consume within 24 hours for best quality.

name: Tengra Fish
nutritionalInfo: Good protein source. Contains calcium and phosphorus.
cookingTips: Clean and fry whole. Excellent as crispy snack or with rice.
storageInfo: Refrigerate immediately. Best consumed within 24 hours.

name: Lobster
nutritionalInfo: Excellent source of protein, omega-3, and minerals. Low in fat.
cookingTips: Steam, grill, or boil. Serve with butter or light sauce. Don't overcook.
storageInfo: Keep alive or frozen. Thaw slowly in refrigerator before cooking.

name: Pabda Fish
nutritionalInfo: High in protein and omega-3. Known for sweet, delicate flavor.
cookingTips: Best prepared as light curry or fried. Handle gently due to soft texture.
storageInfo: Very perishable. Use within 12 hours of purchase.

name: Salmon
description: Imported premium fish, rich in nutrients
nutritionalInfo: Extremely high in omega-3 fatty acids. Rich in vitamin D, B vitamins, and selenium.
cookingTips: Grill, bake, or pan-sear. Pairs well with lemon and herbs. Can be eaten raw as sushi.
storageInfo: Keep frozen until use. Thaw in refrigerator. Use within 48 hours after thawing.

name: Dried Fish
nutritionalInfo: Concentrated protein and minerals. High in calcium and vitamin D.
cookingTips: Soak before cooking if very dry. Perfect for traditional preparations and chutneys.
storageInfo: Store in airtight container in cool, dry place. Long shelf life.

name: Koi Fish
nutritionalInfo: High in protein and iron. Known for health benefits in traditional medicine.
cookingTips: Excellent for curry or jhol. Can be fried whole. Very flavorful.
storageInfo: Keep alive or refrigerate immediately. Use within 24 hours.

name: Squid
nutritionalInfo: Low in calories, high in protein. Rich in selenium, vitamin B12, and phosphorus.
cookingTips: Cook quickly at high heat or slow braise. Perfect for stir-fry, grilling, or curry.
storageInfo: Highly perishable. Use within 24 hours or freeze immediately.
